title: Phoebe Burgess spends a day with her children amid split from Sam
text:
She's reportedly split from her husband Sam for the second time in a year after they rekindled their marriage.

But on Monday, Phoebe Burgess appeared to be in high spirits as she spent time with her daughter Poppy, two, and son Billy, one, following the rumoured separation.

Taking to Instagram stories, the 30-year-old shared a series of videos of her and her children enjoying their time on a farm.

Family fun: NRL WAG Phoebe Burgess (pictured) spent a day gardening and collecting chicken eggs at a farm with her daughter Poppy, two, and son Billy, one, on Monday

In one video, Poppy can be seen walking through a veggie patch while wearing a pair of gumboots.

Another post shows the two-year-old holding chicken eggs in her hands followed by a snap which shows a bucket full of eggs.

In another adorable picture, Poppy and Billy are seated in a wheelbarrow which Phoebe appears to be pulling.

Adventures: Taking to Instagram, Phoebe (pictured) shared a series of videos of herself and her children enjoying a day on a farm

Their family outing comes one day after it was revealed Sam and Phoebe had broken up again, just months after reconciling.

The Sydney Morning Herald reported that the South Sydney Rabbitohs player Sam, moved out of their $3.8 million home in Maroubra towards the end of September.

'They tried to give it a go but it just didn't work,' a source told the publication.

Outing: One post shows Poppy (pictured) holding eggs in her hands as she collects them from a chicken coop

'The most important thing for them is that their children are happy and healthy, that is their priority,' the source added.

The pair had rekindled their marriage after splitting in December last year, just weeks after the birth of their second child.

Sam and Phoebe have not yet publicly commented on their rumoured split.
description: She's reportedly split from her husband Sam for the second time in a year after they rekindled their marriage.
authors: Mary Mrad For Daily Mail Australia
